And he was happy to see the orchestra he founded develop and grow after he stepped down as director\"" }, { "subject" : "Richard Egarr", "predicate" : "added", "obj" : "\"I am deeply saddened by the news of Christopher's passing\"" }, { "subject" : "Richard Egarr", "predicate" : "said", "obj" : "\"Christopher provided a fantastic legacy for me to build upon when I joined in 2006 and I know he will be greatly missed by all who knew and worked with him\"" }, { "subject" : "Dame Emma Kirkby", "predicate" : "said", "obj" : "\"Some of the best players that now lead orchestras all over the world, they started with him.\\nChris was a natural academic, an influential exponent of the early music movement, and a founding member of Early Music Consort of London.\\nThe 1980 version of Handel's Messiah with Emma Kirkby and Carolyn Watkinson is considered one of his most famous recordings.\\nHe studied at Cambridge University under Rafael Puyana and Mary Potts, and later with Zuzana Ruzickova and Gustav Leonhardt.\\nHis first positions were as a keyboard player and musicologist with the Academy of Saint Martin-in-the-Fields under Sir Neville Marriner, and as a founder member of Early Music Consort of London.\\nThe 1980 version of Handel's Messiah with Emma Kirkby and Carolyn Watkinson is considered one of his most famous recordings.\"" } ] , "summary" : "Christopher Hogwood, an influential figure in the early music movement, passed away at age 83 after a long illness.
